text: I can't figure out how to deploy docs for my package <https://github.com/jakobnissen/ErrorTypes.jl>. I can create the docs locally, and I have GitHub actions set up to run the "make.jl", and the action succeeds, but there is no output. Can anyone help me?

elements.text: I can't figure out how to deploy docs for my package
. I can create the docs locally, and I have GitHub actions set up to run the "make.jl", and the action succeeds, but there is no output. Can anyone help me?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
Look at the log, the job is always successful even if deploy failed

elements.text: Look at the log, the job is always successful even if deploy failed

text: Did you add the documenter ssh key?

elements.text: Did you add the documenter ssh key?

text: Maybe I messed that up. I added a secret key created by DocumenterTools, but I never communicated to Documenter what the secret key was

elements.text: Maybe I messed that up. I added a secret key created by DocumenterTools, but I never communicated to Documenter what the secret key was

text: Is it somehow able to reproducibly create that same key?

elements.text: Is it somehow able to reproducibly create that same key?

text: <@U67SCG4HG> Ah, and that's a limitation of Documenter?

elements.text: Ah, and that's a limitation of Documenter?

text: I mean, it could probably be made to support that but that build type wasn't a think when the Documenter support for github actions were added.

elements.text: I mean, it could probably be made to support that but that build type wasn't a think when the Documenter support for github actions were added.

text: Does it work if you just push a commit instead?

elements.text: Does it work if you just push a commit instead?

text: looks like the key doesn't have write access maybe?

elements.text: looks like the key doesn't have write access maybe?

text: Yes, it works now! You were both right, Documenter does not support manual workflows (so I changed that), and I forgot to add the public key to GitHub, I thought only the private would do. Thank you both

elements.text: Yes, it works now! You were both right, Documenter does not support manual workflows (so I changed that), and I forgot to add the public key to GitHub, I thought only the private would do. Thank you both
